results.title: The Gifted ones. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: The gifted child, whose advanced mind distinguishes him from others of his age, is a valuable asset to society. Some say gifted children should be taught in a class of their own. Others say that the average classroom is better for them. The film presents the views of two prominent educators: Dr Florence Dunlop, Ottawa, and Dr. T.W. Martin, Toronto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Don Haldane

results.title: The Gifted child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Can you multiply 65x65 in your head? Do you know what chromosomes are? A seven year old child answers both these questions in a few seconds at the beginning of this film. This film investigates new research into the ways children think and use their imagination, and also new techniques of education.

results.title: The Gift [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, James Jacks, Tom Rosenberg, Gary Lucchesi and Sam Raimi
results.brief_description: Set in Georgia, Cate Blanchett plays Annie Wilson, a young widow with three children to look after. Following an accident that kills her husband, she relies on her psychic visions to give the townsfolk clairvoyant readings regarding their relationships and love lives to earn a little extra money. Annie receives visits from Valerie (Hilary Swank) who is married to Donnie Barksdale (Keanu Reeves), a psychotic wife abuser who warns Annie not to talk to his wife again or he will hurt her and her children. She also has to contend with his taunts of her being a witch - a feeling that is echoed by some of the locals. When young socialite Jessica King (Katie Holmes) goes missing, the local police and her fiancee ask Annie for her help in finding the body and leading them to the murderer. Screenplay by Billy Bob Thornton.

results.title: The Giants
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Zdenka Deitchova and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A satirical cartoon film which exposes and ridicules in allegorical form, human intolerance, malice, cowardice and irresponsibility. Intended as a protest against violence and despotism.

results.title: The Giant radio telescope
results.brief_description: A. C. B. Lovell (professor of radio astronomy, University of Manchester) is interviewed about the new giant radio telescope at Jodrell Bank. This historic film was shot in the early years of radio astronomy and the Jodrell Bank telescope was one of the most advanced of its kind. Lovell would later play a key figure in the space race over the next few years, aiding the Soviet Union in tracking cosmonaughtical space programs.

results.title: The Ghost paintings
results.brief_description: An innovative Melbourne artist, James Clayden has worked in theatre, film and painting for more than 30 years. His ‘Ghost Paintings’ series, produced over the past seventeen years, represents a bold and unique synthesis of film and video art. By combining cryptic fragments of dialogue delivered by actors, with highly saturated unfocused images and a disorienting soundscape, he creates an abstracted visual poetry that defies rational analysis, but that nevertheless invokes thought in the viewer. Cast: Helen Hopkins, Tom Wright, Faruk Avdi, Shelley Lasica, Meg White, Thomas Eckersley. Music: Ad Hoc, The Other (Chris Knowles, David Wadelton, David Brown, James Clayden).

results.title: The Ghost in the shed
results.creator_credit: Bosustow Entertainment, Nick Bosustow and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: A whimsical story of a polite but persistent ghost of a secretly buried murder victim. His attempts to draw attention to his remains mystify the family in the house. Based on the book by Marilynne K. Roach.
